pullRequest.body:
by preferring `decreasing_by` over inline proofs, the resulting
equational theorems are nicer.

Also we can use functional induction in one case rather nicely.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9045585143/job/24855491193)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9045585143/job/24855491292)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9045585143/job/24855491497)

Mathlib typically tries to avoid explicitly mentioning these auto-generated equation lemmas. Is it possible to prove this using some unfolding/simping?

(If not, I don't think it's a deal breaker for this PR :smile:)

Now that these are now longer internal (`.eq_1` instead of `._eq_1`) I wonder if that policy still should be there. My impression is that they have become “normal to use”.

This can be proven using other tactics, of course, or `unseal` + `rfl`. On the train though, and the mathlib cache is too much for the WiFi here :-)

```suggestion
    reverseRecOn [] nil append_singleton = nil := by unfold reverseRecOn; rfl
```

```suggestion
    bidirectionalRec nil singleton cons_append [] = nil := by
  unfold bidirectionalRec; rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: nicer well-founded function definitions
